title: Strengthening Organizational Development Practice Competencies: Ontology-Based Instructional Design Knowledge Modeling Workshop

context.prior_knowledge: Intermediate-level knowledge and practical experience in the relevant field
context.additional_context: Practical competency enhancement program for corporate management/HR/administrative staff

learning_goals: A three-tier instructional design model (goal-process-material) can be constructed using an ontology framework
A language learning scenario is developed by applying flexible knowledge modeling techniques based on domain patterns

Learners analyze a real corporate project case (e.g., new employee onboarding program design) within a week and propose an ADDIE model-based instructional design solution (objectives, assessments, content, methods, media) within five pages, achieving scores of 70+ ("Average") or higher in at least four of five corporate practitioner evaluation rubric items
difficulty: Easy - Simple structure with minimal constraints
